issues.description: The problem statement (and UML) specify an addGuestStudents(int) method (single int parameter). The template, however, declares addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput) with an extra boolean parameter. The solution implements the single-parameter version. This parameter mismatch in the template will confuse students and prevent them from implementing or compiling the method expected by the exercise/tests (they will implement addGuestStudents(int) but the template exposes a different signature).
issues.suggested_fix: Change the template method signature to match the specification: provide public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) (no boolean parameter). If validation logic is desired, either implement it internally or add an overloaded private/helper method with a boolean parameter, but expose the single-parameter public method that matches the problem statement and the solution.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML) specifies a method addGuestStudents(int): void, and the solution implements public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents). However, the template declares a different signature: public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput). This mismatch in the method signature (extra boolean parameter only present in the template) creates a mapping confusion: students reading the problem/UML expect to implement/complete a single-parameter method, but the template forces a different method shape. This can cause uncertainty about which signature to follow and may lead to compilation/test failures or wasted effort reconciling the differences.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template method signature consistent with the problem/UML and the solution by removing the extra boolean parameter. Change the template declaration to: public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) { ... } Alternatively, if the boolean parameter is intentional, update the problem statement/UML and the solution to document and implement addGuestStudents(int, boolean) so all artifacts match.
